ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Chains Reliability
ygData.msgSnippet: Well our other benefit is we almost always have a cleric and a shaman, which in a group of four let s our druids hold back some mana for snaring. One of the
ygData.messageBody:
Well our other benefit is we almost always have a cleric and a shaman, which
in a group of four let's our druids hold back some mana for snaring. One of
the benefits of having a caster heavy group. On the downside I'm the
secondary tank behind a ranger.

Kit

-----Original Message-----
From: Perhaps a Princess... [mailto:sarah@...]
Sent: Monday, March 20, 2000 2:46 PM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Chains Reliability


From: "Perhaps a Princess..." <sarah@...>

>-----Original Message-----
>From: Kimes, Dean W. [mailto:dean_kimes@...]
>Sent: Monday, March 20, 2000 1:35 PM

>heh heh for me I'd rather they snare as a mob approaches 50%. We have this
>problem of letting DoT's do their full damage and many of our fights last 2
>mins. Heck we had a stupid darkness snare wear off on a goblin last nite
>and it was ugly. The necro even admitted he was lazy by just hitting the
>mob once with the slowdown and then not giving it a second thought that
>after 2 minutes it probably wasn't slowed again. I am lucky though in that
>both the druids and ranger that I group with are snare happy if anything.
>No one would accuse them of being snare lazy that's for sure! My guess is
>you aren't snare lazy either Faerain!

You would bet wrong. I've had snares wear off on me. Although, part
of the problem is, by the end of the battle, I am medding
furiously for mana for heals. I have extra mana for snares at the BEGINNING
of the fight (unless someone pulls before I've medded enough mana for
heals, either. My regular partner doesn't do that, Anna Faefriend, but
pickup groups have been bad at not waiting for their healer!) If snare
is resisted three times in a row, they have me not even Snare, and just run
it down
(We're fighting in Mistmoore) Because they'd rather have my mana for heals.
(Though I need to train them to tell me when a second critter enters the
battle so I can astand up and snare that as well)

Not to mention learning to throw snares on things in the first place...
Despite having it always memmed, I have not had to use it much until
lately.

Sarah Heacock sarah@...
Faerain Wanderer, level 20 Soldier of Tunare, Phoenix, Solusek Ro /
Faesong, level 15 HalfElf Bard of Solusek Ro, Phoenix, Solusek Ro (Freeport)
/
Meara, level 14 Enchanter, Master Jeweler, owner Meara's Boutique of
Mystiques, Phoenix, Solusek Ro /
<lvl 4 paladin>
